title: Design Thinking-Based Online Collaborative Problem Solving: Mathematics Domain Intensive Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and proficiency in fundamental digital tools
context.additional_context: Short-term program integrating design thinking with mobile-based collaborative learning for real-world problems requiring graduate-level mathematical thinking

learning_goals: Learners can solve math-based practical problems by applying the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test).
Learners can share and refine ideas with remote team members using digital collaboration tools (e.g., Figma, Miro).
Learners can reinterpret complex mathematical problems through human-centered approaches and submit solutions using visual thinking techniques.

resources: Digital Whiteboard Tool for Mathematical Problem Solving
Collaborative Cloud Storage for Group Assignments

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
